title: Senior Fullstack utvecklare
description:
- **Vill du vara med på resan när vi startar upp vår Creative tech enhet i Göteborg? Vill du arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande, glada och kompetenta kollegor i ett av Göteborgs mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Söker du en roll där du som konsult får vara med och skapa innovativa digitala produkter?**  



**Om rollen**  

Som fullstack-utvecklare kommer du att bidra med att bygga högkvalitativa lösningar och stabil kodbas till våra kunder som förser dem med verkligt affärsvärde. Att vara en del av ett team innebär delat ägandeskap och ansvar och vi förväntar oss att du är del av utvecklingsprocessen samtidigt som du tillför din expertis inom till exempel cloudlösningar, databas-migreringar, frontend-utveckling eller dev-ops.


***För denna roll krävs det att du är flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift, observera att vi endast beaktar sökande med giltigt arbetsvisum och kvalificerade arbetstillstånd.***  



**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?**  

För att lyckas i rollen som fullstack-utvecklare tror vi att du är öppen för att möta nya idéer och är flexibel när det kommer till att möta nya utmaningar. Du njuter av samarbete och är bekväm med att dela med dig av din kunskap till kollegor och kunder. För att lyckas i rollen och på Devoteam Creative Tech tror vi även att du är ödmjuk och har en lösningsfokuserad approach.  

  




	* Teknisk expertis: Ungefär 5 års erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling
	* God vana av att skriva testbar och skalbar kod i React eller Vue, TypeScript/Javascript, Node.js
	* Erfarenhet av backend-språk och plattformar som Node.js, Go, Java eller .Net/ C#
	* Förstå värdet av kodgranskning och dess funktion i mjukvaruutveckling
	* God förståelse och erfarenhet av designa och utveckla API:er
	* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila teams
	* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade lösningar som AWS, GCP eller Azure
	* Relationsdatabaser och NoSQL
	* Bekväm i att hålla djupa tekniska diskussioner på Svenska och Engelska
	* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift**Även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**


	* Mjukvaruarkitektur (exempelvis event-baserad arkitektur)
	* CI/CD pipelines
	* Data engineering (exempelvis datamodellering, ETL, etc)**Arbetsplats**  

Arbetsplatsen för den här rollen är Göteborg med omnejd.  

  



**Om Devoteam**  

Hos oss värderar vi medarbetarnas trivsel och utveckling högt. Vi har byggt en arbetskultur där människor känner sig inspirerade, utmanade och trygga. Vi tror att när du trivs och växer, så gör även våra lösningar det.


Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultföretag med en stark förankring i Malmös och Halmstad tech-community, både som Devoteam och f.d .Jayway. Nu ska vi äntligen etablera oss i Göteborg. Vi är engagerade i att skapa långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och medarbetare. Vi drivs av en passion för teknik och innovation, och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar för företag inom en rad olika branscher. Bland våra initiativ kan nämnas Øredev , en av Skandinaviens största utvecklarkonferenser, som vi var med och grundade.


**Förmåner och praktisk information:**


	* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
	* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård, hälsokontroller och lunchyoga på kontoret.
	* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.


För eventuella frågor, kontakta Sanna Ekelöf, vår rekryterare, på sanna.ekelof@devoteam.com. Sanna kommer att vara din primära kontaktperson under hela rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Senior Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Expertkunskap i Java
* Erfarenhet av Ada
* Goda färdigheter i minst ett ytterligare programmeringsspråk
* Goda kunskaper i hur versionshantering fungerar (Git/CVS/etc.)
* Goda kunskaper i hur man arbetar agilt (Scrum/Kanban)
* Goda kunskaper i Linux
* Goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska, både i tal och skrift

  

**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av C/C++
* Kunskaper i olika byggsystem (Jenkins, Make, etc.)
* Kunskaper i virtualisering, nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Vana att arbeta i flera olika programmeringsspråk/ramverk

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 23-09-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Utveckla med AI - Senior Java-utvecklare
description:
- **Vill du arbeta med ett gäng glada och trevliga människor i Halmstads mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Brinner du för att leverera i interna produktteam eller som specialistkonsult? Och kanske framförallt, ser du möjligheterna i att använda AI drivna utvecklarverktyg som Windsurf eller Cursor i din vardag för att skapa värde för våra kunder?**  

  

**Vilka är vi?**  

Vi är ett IT-konsultföretag som främjar en kultur där medarbetarna känner sig trygga, inspirerade och glada. Vi tror att detta är den bästa miljön där människor kan växa och bygga de bästa produkterna. Vi grundades år 2000, ser långsiktigt på våra kund- och medarbetarrelationer och hoppas du ska vilja stanna länge hos oss.


Visste du att vi faktiskt också grundade utvecklarkonferensen Øredev som fortfarande är en del av samma företag?

  
**Vem är du?**  

Vi tror att du har 5+ års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, är en nyfiken och ödmjuk person samt en lagspelare. Du gillar också att dela med dig av din kunskap på ett sätt som passar dig bra. Vi ser också att du har använt dig av utvecklarverktyg där du med prompting snabbare kan styra utvecklingen av mjukvara. Är du dessutom en person som vill dela med dig av dina AI-kunskaper till dina kollegor? Då kommer du känna dig som hemma hos oss!


  
***För denna roll krävs det att du är flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift, samt är villig att arbeta i Halmstad med omnejd 3-5 dagar i veckan.***  

  

**Du kommer att arbeta med:**

* Java SE/EE
* Spring Framework/Spring Boot
* API:er
* Git
* Agila utvecklingsmetoder
* Molnteknologier - AWS, GCP eller Azure.
* Promptade utveckling i verktyg såsom Cursor, Windsurf eller liknande

**Du kommer ha möjlighet att arbeta med:**

* Microservices
* DevOps
* CI/CD
* Containers (Docker/Kubernetes)

  
- **Förmåner och praktisk information:**


	* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
	* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård och hälsokontroller.
	* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.**Vill du veta mer?**  

Skicka in din ansökan till oss så kontaktar vi dig så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


**En rättvis chans.**  

Devoteam är öppet för ansökningar från alla delar av samhället. Vi tror att olikheter inom team hjälper oss att skapa bättre produkter. Vi välkomnar alla människor oavsett ålder, könsidentitet eller uttryck, erfarenhet och bakgrund. Om du kan se dig själv i denna roll och känner att denna tjänst kan tillföra värde både för dig och för Devoteam, uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in din ansökan till oss - även om du inte nödvändigtvis uppfyller alla ovanstående krav.


**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.


För eventuella frågor, kontakta Sanna Ekelöf, vår rekryterare, på *sanna.ekelof@devoteam.com* . Sanna kommer att vara din primära kontaktperson under hela rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Full-Stack Developer Internship
description:
Do you want to be involved in continuously building a SaaS solution? Are you eager to work closely with the
 **co-founder & CTO** 
 of an innovative startup that’s transforming the e-commerce returns landscape? If you’re passionate about delivering value to customers and shaping a B2B product, this is the internship for you!
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* You will be involved in everything from new feature development, bug solving and releasing new versions to our production environment.
* You will also interact with our UI/UX team and frontend developers.
* You will be able to understand everything which goes into building our SaaS solution.
* You will also be involved in requirement gathering and interact with our customers when it comes to enhancements and bug-fixing.


**Who you are:**
* Internship should be part of your coursework.
* Fluent in English communication skills (other European languages are a plus)
* Web programming knowledge - preferably Python and React.js
* Understanding of how websites work end-to-end
* Sql skills


**Bonus skills:**
* Knowledge of HTML / CSS / Javascript


**Internship details:**
* Location: Stockholm, with one to two days per week available for home office
* Duration: 5 to 6 months, with start date as soon as possible
* Compensation: This is an unpaid internship, ideal for students or recent graduates looking for real-world experience


 Are you ready to launch your career in product development?

title: Software Engineer - JavaScript
description:
We are looking for an exceptional engineer who wants to help shape the future of asset based lending.
 




  





**Why Camboza** 





 Built by fintech veterans and backed by top-tier investors, Camboza is on a mission to reshape personal finance in Europe. We use cutting-edge technology and AI to give people instant access to the value in what they already own — their car, their crypto, their valuables - turning them into financial flexibility, without debt traps or hidden risks.
 




  






 We’re a small, passionate team in Stockholm building a company that will redefine an entire industry. We value ownership, speed, and collaboration without ego. We’re looking for people who care deeply about their craft, challenge assumptions, and want to build something with lasting impact.
 




  





**About the role** 





 We’re looking for an exceptional full-stack engineer to join our small, ambitious team in Stockholm. You’ll own core parts of our product, from building the infrastructure to support thousands of loans, to delivering on-demand valuation features and automating internal processes. Expect to work across the stack: backend, frontend, and infra while shaping product strategy alongside the team. 
 




  





**What we looking for** 



* Proficient in TypeScript and Node.js.
* Experienced with common JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
* Fluent in modern frontend (React/TypeScript) and backend development
* Solid understanding of systems design, performance tradeoffs, and scalable architecture
* Strong product sense and ability to make well-reasoned technical decisions, knowing when to prioritize speed and when to invest in foundational work



  





  





  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Design, optimize, and scale robust financial systems (Node.js, Postgres) across the stack
* Build on-demand valuation features and internal automation tools to streamline processes
* Own the full development lifecycle: from planning to shipping and continuous improvement
* Shape our system architecture to ensure scalability, reliability, and security
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and business teams to influence both technical and product strategy



  





**Our tech stack** 



* Frontend: React + Next.js (TypeScript)
* Backend: Node.js + Express.js
* APIs: REST & GraphQL
* Database: PostgreSQL
* Cloud: GCP



  





  





**What’s in it for you** 



* Career growth in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment
* Impact & ownership — your voice matters, your work shapes the product
* Competitive salary + transparent and highly competitive options program

* Team culture: regular meetups, social gatherings, and a collaborative, high-energy environment

title: Backend Developer Intern [Remote]
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a

 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially

 , exceptional performance may lead to a

 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:**

 : Build and maintain high-performance REST APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 .
* **Database Management** 
 : Work with

 and ORM tools (Sequelize) to design and optimize database schemas.

* **Testing & Quality Assurance**

 to ensure stability and performance.

 : Learn to work with

 and contribute to maintaining scalable, secure environments.
* **Troubleshooting & Maintenance** 
 : Help debug, patch, and optimize backend systems to improve reliability.
* **Code Reviews** 
 : Participate in peer reviews to maintain code quality and follow industry best practices.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js**
* Solid
 **JavaScript** 
 &
 **TypeScript** 
 skills
* Experience with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 (basic to intermediate)
* Familiarity with
 **AWS services** 
 (some training provided)
* Understanding of
 **Git** 
 (we use Bitbucket)
* Basic knowledge of
 **CI/CD pipelines**
* Awareness of
 **IT security fundamentals**

 **Sequelize ORM**



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience building backend systems for
 **real-world AR applications**
* Exposure to

 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Java Build Engineer
description:
*Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we’re also on a mission* 
*–* 
*to build a better world through the power of play.*
*Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It’s the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.*
 We enable millions to create and play together, connect people across the globe, and foster a community that is among the most active and passionate in the world. Our community is global and incredibly diverse. When we are developing anything within our franchise, we keep this in mind. We want everyone to not only feel included in Minecraft, but also to see themselves in what we make. Our goal is for the Mojang Studios team to be as diverse as our community. Minecraft is a sandbox game that should be around for a lifetime. Minecraft runs on two platforms today, the Java platform and the Bedrock platform.
   

  

**What you’ll get**
 We, the Minecraft Java Platform team, are an inclusive group with varying levels of experience, working together in closely knit teams. We are responsible for designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining the Java Platform for Minecraft: Java Edition.
   

  

 We are looking for a Build Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will take on challenges related to implementing and improving our workflows. This is a fantastic opportunity to deepen your knowledge of our platforms and development practices, while making a significant impact on the exciting projects Mojang is working on.
   

  

 As part of the team, you will also be responsible for maintaining our current build systems and related tools, while providing daily guidance and support to developers.
   

  

**Technical requirements:**
* Strong knowledge of CI/CD best practices and philosophy
* Expertise at CI/CD tools (e.g. TeamCity, Jenkins, Azure DevOps)
* Good knowledge of Azure or other cloud services
* Knowledge of Python programing
* Experience with build automation tools (e.g. Gradle, Maven)


**We also value:**
* Knowledge of Django framework
* Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps pipelines
* Good knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. PowerShell, Bash)
* Good knowledge of Java programming language.
* Knowledge of tools for managing infrastructure with code (e.g. Terraform)


**Soft skills requirements:**
* Collaborative, work together with other teams and people.
* Communicative, build engineer is a very central role that needs to collaborate with many other people
* Self-leadership is key, as we rely on you to establish our future-proof build system and tools. You are confident and able to speak your mind when changes are needed. Furthermore, you naturally take a holistic approach to problem-solving and are adaptable to unexpected changes and challenges


**About this role:**
 This is a full-time role based in Stockholm with a hybrid remote working model. You'll collaborate closely with our studio colleagues in Redmond, USA, and across various disciplines. Please note that we are only considering candidates currently based in Sweden
   

  

 In the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come and help us reach it!
   

  

**Mojang Studios**
*Mojang Studios is a Microsoft-owned game developer. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We’re always working on new and exciting ways to expand the Minecraft universe.*
*Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.*
*We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we’re also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.*
*To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by Söder Mälarstrand, it’s filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.*
*But in the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!*
***Important note on resumes**
 Please make sure that
 **all** 
 the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we’d hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!*

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
We're working with a fast-growing, product-focused tech company based in Stockholm that is looking to hire a Senior .NET Developer. This is a hybrid role, requiring a few days per week in their central Stockholm office. The team builds scalable backend systems that support a high-traffic, global user base, and they're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation who can contribute to long-term architectural decisions while remaining hands-on in daily development. All communication is in English, and the working environment is highly international.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 6+ years of professional experience with .NET (C#, .NET Core/.NET 6+)
* Solid experience building and maintaining APIs and microservices
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relational databases such as PostgreSQL or SQL Server
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, ideally Azure
* Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and version control (Git)

**Nice to have:**

* Interest or background in telecoms, mobile services, or payments

title: Product Developer – Weekday Womenswear Heavy Woven
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you an experienced and passionate Product Developer with a strong background in womenswear heavy woven garments?
   

  

 Join our creative and fast-paced assortment team at Weekday, where you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our women’s outerwear and woven collections.
   

  

 Our brand includes Weekday Woman, Weekday Man, and Monki. We believe our success comes from the incredible people in our team, where ownership, collaboration, creativity, and engagement are key to creating standout products.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

 As Product Developer for Weekday Womenswear Heavy Woven, you will:
   

  

* Lead product development from concept to final execution, with a strong focus on heavy woven garments
* Develop and execute agile development strategies aligned with assortment goals
* Manage timelines and ensure smooth execution of projects
* Develop pricing strategies to ensure competitiveness and profitability
* Source materials, negotiate with suppliers, and manage bookings
* Oversee sample development, components, and quality assurance
* Handle returns and enforce product policies
* Collaborate closely with the production office to optimize workflows and efficiencies


 Who you’ll work with
   

  

 You’ll be part of a small, collaborative team including a planner and pattern maker. The team combines long-standing colleagues with newer members, creating a dynamic and inclusive environment.
   

  

 This role is dedicated to womenswear heavy woven, with a strong focus on outerwear and structured garments.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Who you are
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with:
   

  

* Several years of experience in product development within fashion or retail
* Proven expertise in heavy woven womenswear, especially outerwear
* Strong commercial understanding and customer focus
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written
* Experience working with youth-oriented fashion is a plus
* A degree in textiles, fashion buying, or a related field is a merit


 And someone who is:
   

  

* Structured, detail-oriented, and skilled at prioritizing
* Proactive and thrives in a fast-paced environment
* Flexible, solution-driven, and open to change
* A team player with great energy, drive, and a positive attitude
* Curious, growth-minded, and comfortable working both independently and collaboratively


**Additional Information**
 This is a full time temporary contract for 12 months based at our Head Office in Södermalm Stockholm
   

  

 If you feel this opportunity is exciting feel free to apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than the 26/9. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 In this role you will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is part of our offer, approx. 4 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and team work.
   

  

 Please note this position is offered on a local contract, therefore you should have the legal right to work in Sweden before applying. Other candidates are welcome to register their interest, and we will keep you in mind for future opportunities.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Weekday is where culture moves fast and expression runs deep. Your everyday remix wrapped in denim. Too much, not enough, perfect. A wardrobe of contrasts: Effortless basics, monochrome shades, and edgy cuts. The signature jeans that go with everything—and express it all. More than fashion - it’s a moment, a mood, culture in motion. Every version, all at once.
   

  

 Monki is a state of mind, wearing the moods all the time. From hot basics to It-dresses and skirts, wild prints to match whatever feels right. It’s about the energy, the fierce force that’s always on point and ever-present. It’s being curious —imagining it, making it real, because style is never just one thing. Learn more about Weekday here.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to this, WEEKDAY-based colleagues also receive:
   

  

* 30 days holiday
* A collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal


 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Fullstack Developer - Node
description:
We are looking for an exceptional engineer who wants to help shape the future of asset based lending.
 




  





**Why Camboza** 





 Built by fintech veterans and backed by top-tier investors, Camboza is on a mission to reshape personal finance in Europe. We use cutting-edge technology and AI to give people instant access to the value in what they already own — their car, their crypto, their valuables - turning them into financial flexibility, without debt traps or hidden risks.
 




  






 We’re a small, passionate team in Stockholm building a company that will redefine an entire industry. We value ownership, speed, and collaboration without ego. We’re looking for people who care deeply about their craft, challenge assumptions, and want to build something with lasting impact.
 




  





**About the role** 





 We’re looking for an exceptional full-stack engineer to join our small, ambitious team in Stockholm. You’ll own core parts of our product, from building the infrastructure to support thousands of loans, to delivering on-demand valuation features and automating internal processes. Expect to work across the stack: backend, frontend, and infra while shaping product strategy alongside the team. 
 




  





**What we looking for** 



* Proficient in TypeScript and Node.js.
* Experienced with common JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
* Fluent in modern frontend (React/TypeScript) and backend development
* Solid understanding of systems design, performance tradeoffs, and scalable architecture
* Strong product sense and ability to make well-reasoned technical decisions, knowing when to prioritize speed and when to invest in foundational work



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Design, optimize, and scale robust financial systems (Node.js, Postgres) across the stack
* Build on-demand valuation features and internal automation tools to streamline processes
* Own the full development lifecycle: from planning to shipping and continuous improvement
* Shape our system architecture to ensure scalability, reliability, and security
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and business teams to influence both technical and product strategy



  





**Our tech stack** 



* Frontend: React + Next.js (TypeScript)
* Backend: Node.js + Express.js
* APIs: REST & GraphQL
* Database: PostgreSQL
* Cloud: GCP



  





**What’s in it for you** 



* Career growth in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment
* Impact & ownership — your voice matters, your work shapes the product
* Competitive salary + transparent and highly competitive options program
* Hybrid work: our office is in central Stockholm, but remote is possible too
* Benefits: pension plan, parental leave, 30 days vacation, health coverage
* Team culture: regular meetups, social gatherings, and a collaborative, high-energy environment
* Tech gear of your choice: Mac or Microsoft setups

title: Junior Game Designer
description:
Are you a game designer who want to work with a small but ambitious team where making an impact on the games we develop is not a perk, but a common goal? We are looking for a hands-on designer who can take your tasks from concept to final implementation, always with the players experience in mind.
 



  





**About us** 




 COFFEE STAIN NORTH is a small game developer based in Stockholm that belongs to the Coffee Stain Group. Since the company was founded in 2013, we have grown to 30 employees and are now open to adding a couple of new friends!
 



  





*Goat Simulator 3 is a third-person sandbox adventure developed by Coffee Stain North in which the player can live out their wildest dreams... as a goat. Released in 2022, this open-world sandbox game takes the chaotic spirit of the original to new heights and offers expanded multiplayer support, a larger and more detailed environment, and even more absurd physics-driven gameplay* 
 . Players can explore the island of San Angora solo or with friends, wreaking havoc as a goat (or one of many unlockable characters) through a wide range of quests, mini-games, and bizarre encounters.
 



  





*Understanding games like Goat Simulator 3 means appreciating the fine line between "broken" and "brilliant." If that sounds like your kind of energy, come and get to know our herd!* 




  





**The role** 




 As Designer at CSN, you will work hands on in engine, implement features/content, be part of content ideation, as well as fix issues.
 



 You will:
 


* Carry ideas from conceptualization through to detailed design.
* Create prototypes and make final implementations for gameplay mechanics and objectives.
* Ensure that the features you develop are coherent with other game systems and the overall game vision.



  





**Your background** 




 To succeed in the role, we see that you have worked one to three years as a game designer, and have experience with Unreal Engine 4 and Blueprint visual scripting language.
 



 As you will be working closely with the rest of the design team, we believe that you are a person who communicate openly and understand that sharing suggestions, demoing work and voicing advice and ideas will enrich both your teamwork and the game. If you also enjoy infusing your work with humor, we believe that you would enjoy working with us!
 



 At CSN we have employees from different parts of the world, and it’s therefore mandatory to be fluent in English, both verbally and in writing.
 



  





**Perks** 
 of working at Coffee Stain
 



 We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits that go beyond the usual payments to your pension fund and insurances.
 


* We believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so on top of the wellness grant you get some paid time off to work out. Did we mention there are several gyms right beside our office?
* Every fourth week it’s creative Friday which lets your inner passion blossom.
* To have fun together and get inspired, we play games on the clock every fourth Friday.
* We also have great parental benefits, including extra pay on top of what you get from the social insurance agency during your parental leave.
* And, of course, you will be part of a wonderful team of colleagues working on an exciting high-profile project.



  





**Practical info** 




 The position is permanent, full-time, 40 hours per week. We have a hybrid setup and offer the possibility of working from home 2 days per week. Our office is newly renovated, and located in Kungsholmen, Fridhesmplan. We have, among other things, a ping-pong table, a big lounge area where we hang out, watch movies, or play games together, and last but not least – a giant goat statue (what more do you need?).
 



  





 Apart from us, the Coffee Stain Group consists of a myriad of successful studios, among them COFFEE STAIN STUDIOS (Sanctum and Satisfactory), Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic), Tuxedo Labs (Teardown) and COFFEE STAIN PUBLISHING who work with close partners like Iron Gate (Valheim), to name a few.
 



  





**Your application** 




 If you are interested, please apply! Due to GDPR, we can’t accept applications through email. If you have any questions regarding the role, please reach out to Maria Sjöman, HR,
 



 maria.sjoman@coffeestain.com

title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
**About** 




 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
 



**Role Overview**




 We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer to join our growing software team. In this role, you will design and build scalable, high-performance applications that connect embedded systems, cloud infrastructure, and user interfaces. Your work will directly support the monitoring, diagnostics, and control of our marine battery systems and at the same time support our developing efforts in cloud with both frontend and backend work.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design and implement software for battery management system based on maritime standards


* Build robust APIs and backend services to interface with embedded systems and cloud platforms in a Linux environment.


* Develop intuitive and responsive front-end interfaces for internal tools and customer-facing dashboards.


* Collaborate with embedded, test, and systems engineers to ensure seamless integration across the stack.


* Implement secure, scalable, and maintainable software architectures.


* Contribute to DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.


* Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and technical mentoring.



**Required Skills:** 



* Strong experience in fullstack development using modern frameworks, preferably Angular, Typescript and C#.


* Proficiency in designing RESTful APIs and working with IoT Solutions.


* Experience in developing hardware-near applications


* Solid understanding of software architecture and cyber security.


* Familiarity with data visualization, telemetry, and system monitoring tools.


* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.


* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.



**Bonus Points:** 



* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).


* Experience with Agile development methodologies.


* Experience in developing embedded applications using C.


* Experience with Linux systems administration.


* Experience with CI/CD and build automation with GitHub Actions


* Familiarity with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and message brokers (e.g., MQTT, Kafka).


* Knowledge of maritime compliance standards



  





**Why Join Echandia Marine?** 




**Impact** 
 : Work on groundbreaking technology that will shape the future of sustainable marine transport.
 



**Growth** 
 : Develop your skills in a dual role that combines technical leadership with product strategy.
 



**Innovation** 
 : Join a culture that values creativity, collaboration and innovation at every level.
 



**Mission** 
 : Be part of a purpose-driven company working to make the marine industry cleaner and more efficient.
 



 The right candidate will be part of a fast growing, non-hierarchical and business focused scale-up company fighting climate change through zero-emission electrification.

title: Mobile App developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* At least 5 years of the mobile development experience
* 3+ years of mobile development experience using React Native
* Experience in native iOS and/or native Android development
* Understanding of fundamental design principles for building a scalable application
* Excellent written and speaking English skills


**Application deadline:** 
 22-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Software Engineer at Legora, you’ll play a key role in building the technical foundation that powers our products, designing, developing, and improving the core systems used by legal professionals around the world. You’ll work across the stack, contributing to the architecture and features that define our platform.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead the design, development, and deployment of end-to-end features for our web platform, ensuring high performance, security, and reliability.
* Take full ownership of critical parts of the codebase, balancing quality, scalability, and speed of development.
* Work with technologies such as React, Node.js, AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes, leveraging the right tools to solve complex challenges.
* Collaborate closely with product and design teams to translate requirements into elegant, robust technical solutions.
* Review code and mentor colleagues, raising the overall technical bar and fostering a culture of excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement by challenging assumptions, exploring new technologies, and pushing both yourself and the team to innovate.
* Contribute to infrastructure, integrations, and architecture discussions to ensure the platform evolves sustainably.


 Who you are
   

  

* An engineer with experience building and shipping modern software products.
* Comfortable working across the stack, with solid skills in backend development.
* Passionate about writing maintainable, secure code—and take pride in building things that last.
* A problem solver who enjoys thinking about architecture, data flows, and long-term sustainability.
* Familiar with cloud infrastructure, distributed systems, and integrations (experience with enterprise-scale systems is a plus, but not required).
* Proactive, curious, and motivated by working in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment.


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Java Software Engineer
description:
A rapidly growing fintech company is developing a next-generation spend management and payment solution aimed at streamlining business finances and removing manual processes. With a growing footprint across the Nordics and an expanding user base, the company is set for continued growth. Operating with a tech-driven, product-focused mindset, the engineering team is encouraged to build scalable, innovative solutions using modern technologies and agile workflows.
 



  





**The Role** 




 Join a growing tech team where you’ll collaborate with experienced engineers in a supportive, agile environment. This role offers the chance to contribute to product architecture and direction while building backend business logic and APIs in Java. You’ll also work with CI/CD pipelines and modern cloud infrastructure to help shape and deliver new solutions from the ground up.
 



  





**Tech Stack** 




 Java, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, AWS, Docker, CircleCI
 



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or similar
* 4+ years of backend development experience in Java
* Passion for clean, testable code and agile development
* Strong team player who enjoys solving complex problems
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**What’s on Offer** 



* Join a fast-growing product company with a flat, supportive culture
* Work with a high-performing, fun, and experienced team
* Great Stockholm office with flexible working
* Freedom to shape your responsibilities and growth

title: Frontend Developer Stockholm, Valtech
description:
Why Valtech? We’re the experience innovation company - a trusted partner to the world’s most recognized brands. To our people we offer growth opportunities, a values-driven culture, international careers and the chance to shape the future of experience.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 At Valtech, you’ll find an environment designed for continuous learning, meaningful impact, and professional growth. Whether you're pioneering new digital solutions, challenging conventional thinking or building the next generation of customer experiences, your work will help transform industries.
   

  

**We Are Proud Of**
* The work we do and the innovation we drive
* Our values of share, care and dare
* A workplace culture that fosters creativity, diversity and autonomy
* Our borderless, global framework, which enables seamless collaboration


**The role**
 Valtech is looking for a Frontend Developer with 5+ years of experience. Are you passionate about frontend technologies, do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Are you fluent in Swedish? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
   

  

**A day in the life of a Frontend Developer**
 As a Frontend Developer, you will play a pivotal role as both a consultant/client advisor, and a hands-on developer. Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients. Your role as a consultant/client advisor will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
   

  

**In addition, you will:**
* Act as a trusted advisor to our clients, offering expert guidance and solutions to address their business needs
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy frontend solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle


**You and the role**
 You are someone with at least 5+ years of experience in the field of frontend development with specific focus on React. You’re passionate about building scalable, and maintainable user interfaces and enjoy collaborating with teams across functions to deliver exceptional digital experiences.
   

  

 Your technical experience should also include some but not necessarily all of the following:
   

  

* Javascript, HTML, CSS
* TypeScript
* Vue/Next.js or other React frameworks
* Headless CMS architectures and technologies
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence
* CMS/eCommerce platforms like Optimizely, Sitecore, Adobe etc.


**We would love if you have**
* At least 5+ years of experience in frontend development, especially within modern frontend stacks
* Solid experience with React and its ecosystem
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (A11Y, WCAG, etc.) to build inclusive and compliant web applications
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Fluency in both Swedish and English


**If you do not meet all the listed qualifications or have gaps in your experience, we still encourage you to apply. At Valtech, we recognize that talent comes in many forms, and we value diverse perspectives and a willingness to learn.**
**Commitment to reaching all kinds of people**
 We design experiences that work for all kinds of people - and that starts with our own teams. At Valtech, we’re intentional about building an inclusive culture where everyone feels supported to grow, thrive and achieve their goals. No matter your background, you belong here. Explore our Diversity & Inclusion site to see how we’re creating a more equitable Valtech for all.
   

  

**The Benefits**
 This is a
 **full time** 
 position based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

**Beyond a Competitive Compensation Package, We Offer**
* Flexibility, with remote and hybrid work options (country-dependent)
* Career advancement, with international mobility and professional development programs
* Learning and development, with access to cutting-edge tools, training and industry experts


 Our benefits are tailored to each location. Your Talent Partner will provide full details during the hiring process.
   

  

**Your application process**
 Once you apply, our Talent Acquisition team will review your application. If your skills and experience align with the role, we’ll reach out for next steps.
   

  

 ⚠️ Beware of recruitment fraud: Only engage with official Valtech email addresses ending in @valtech.com.
   

  

 We are committed to inclusion and accessibility. If you need reasonable accommodations during the interview process, please either indicate it in your application or let your Talent Partner know.
   

  

**About Valtech**
 Valtech is the experience innovation company that exists to unlock a better way to experience the world. By blending crafts, categories, and cultures, we help brands unlock new value in an increasingly digital world.
   

  

 At the intersection of data, AI, creativity, and technology, we drive transformation for leading organizations, including L’Oréal, Mars, Audi, P&G, Volkswagen Dolby, and more.
   

  

 At Valtech, we don’t just talk about transformation. We make it happen. Our people are the heart of our success, and we foster a workplace where everyone has the support to thrive, grow and innovate.
   

  

 Are you ready to create what’s next? Join us!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**🚀 Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer – Stockholm** 




  





 Are you a seasoned software engineer passionate about
 **Generative AI** 
 and eager to shape a product from the ground up?
 



  





 We’re working with a
 **market-leading SaaS provider** 
 whose cloud-based platform is trusted by some of the world’s biggest brands. They are now making a
 **major strategic investment into AI** 
 and are building a brand-new AI team in Stockholm.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




  





 You’ll be the first senior hire in a newly established AI team, responsible for:
 



  




* Designing and driving the
 **technical roadmap** 
 for AI adoption within the product.
* Building
 **AI infrastructure and agentic workflows** 
 from scratch.
* Leveraging
 **LLMs, RAG pipelines, and cloud-native tooling** 
 to integrate GenAI directly into a large-scale SaaS platform.
* Working closely with engineering leadership and product teams to deliver features that will transform how global users interact with the platform.
* Mentoring colleagues and setting best practices (no people management initially, but scope to step into a lead role as the team grows).



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* Strong
 **software engineering background** 
 with experience building real-world products.
* Proven track record of implementing
 **GenAI solutions** 
 (LLMs, RAG, agentic AI, prompt-based workflows, etc.).
* Hands-on experience with
 **cloud platforms** 
 (AWS preferred, but strong Azure/GCP profiles considered).
* Proficiency in backend languages such as
 **Node.js/TypeScript, Go, Python, or PHP** 
 .
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to influence technical direction and mentor others.



  





**What’s on Offer** 




  




* 🌴
 **30 days’ vacation**
* 💪 4,000 SEK wellness allowance
* 🏡 2,500 SEK home office allowance
* 🛡 ITP1 pension + life & occupational insurances
* Hybrid setup –
 **Stockholm-based with onsite collaboration a few days per week**



  





**Why Apply?** 




  




* Join a
 **global SaaS leader** 
 at the start of their AI journey.

 **shape the AI strategy and roadmap** 
 .
* Work in a
 **collaborative, low-ego culture** 
 with real investment into learning and development.
* Be part of a small but growing AI team with clear potential to step into future leadership.



  





 👉 Sound interesting? Apply today to be part of building the future of AI-powered SaaS platforms.

title: Software engineer
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll* 
*.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Välkommen till avdelningen som levererar ledningssystem för flygledning! Vi befinner oss på en spännande resa inom produktutveckling, med målet att leverera produkter snabbare och mer effektivt, vilket i slutändan gynnar våra kunder och Saab som helhet. Vi söker en erfaren mjukvaruutvecklare med bred kompetens inom både backend och frontend, samt erfarenhet av utveckling av mikrotjänster och containerlossningar. Du kommer att ingå i olika team som arbetar med allt från prototyper till implementering av monolitiska och containerbaserade lösningar.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden kommer att vara:
   

  

* Vidareutveckling och underhåll av befintliga produkter.
* Arbete med både backend och frontend.
* Utveckling av prototyper och omvandling av befintliga produkter till mikrotjänster och containerbaserade lösningar.
* Troubleshooting och felrättning.
* Vidareutveckling av vår designmiljö.
* Arbeta i olika team och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt för att hitta lösningar.


 Din profil
   

  

 Du har ett stort intresse för programmering och minst 7 års arbetslivserfarenhet som mjukvaruutvecklare. Du brinner för att lära dig mer och ständigt bli bättre.
   

  

 Vi förväntar oss att du som söker har:
   

  

* Kandidat- eller magisterexamen inom teknik eller ett närliggande område.
* Bevisad erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, både backend och frontend.
* Goda färdigheter i flera programmeringsspråk, gärna inom Java, Python, Bash, ADA, C eller C++.
* Bevisad erfarenhet av utveckling av mikrotjänster och containerbaserade lösningar.
* Kunskaper i Docker och Kubernetes.
* Kunskaper i Git och Linux.
* Kunskaper i DevOps.
* God problemlösningsförmåga.
* Positiv grundsyn och vilja att ta ansvar.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Vi värdesätter inte bara dina kunskaper och erfarenheter, utan lägger också stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi söker en samarbetsvillig person som trivs i en teammiljö och aktivt bidrar till en positiv och stödjande arbetsplatskultur.
   

  

 Observera att urvalsarbetet för denna rekrytering startar under vecka 42.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 Vill du lära känna vår verksamhet och personal lite bättre? Här kan du hitta berättelser från några av våra anställda.

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 3 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Embedded Software Engineer
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
För att möta dagens behov och driva framtida expansion söker vi erfarna embeddedutvecklare som vill vara med och bygga upp vår nästa generations embedded software-kapabilitet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi befinner oss i en stark tillväxtfas och behöver tänka innovativt när det gäller effektivitet och skalbarhet. Därför etablerar vi nu den första fasen av vår centrala kompetens inom Embedded Software, med ambitionen att utvecklas till en ledande mjukvarupipeline som en del av vår mjukvarutransformationsresa.
   

  

 För att lyckas med detta söker vi en engagerad och driven person med några års erfarenhet av utveckling inom embedded software. Du är någon som trivs med att utveckla både teknik och organisation, och som gärna arbetar nära ditt team och chefer för att bygga vår nästa generations embedded software-verksamhet. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att forma något nytt och annorlunda – inte bara ur ett tekniskt perspektiv, utan även i hur vi bygger upp och utvecklar verksamheten.
   

  

 Ditt huvudsakliga fokus kommer att vara design och implementation av inbyggd mjukvara. Du kommer att vara delaktig i flera steg i utvecklingsprocessen – från förstudier till integration och verifiering hos kund – med möjligheter till kundkontakt och tjänsteresor.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med både kommersiella (COTS) och egenutvecklade mjukvaru- och hårdvarukomponenter, vilket kräver en förmåga att integrera dessa till fungerande system. Utöver kärnutvecklingsarbetet värdesätter vi också ditt engagemang i att förbättra våra arbetssätt och bidra till att bygga upp vår embedded software-kompetens.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att trivas i rollen är du proaktiv, tar ägarskap över dina uppgifter och har ett genuint driv att driva projekt framåt. Du är nyfiken, utåtriktad och tvekar inte att söka svar inom organisationen. Du samarbetar effektivt med ditt team och delar vår ambition att nå gemensamma mål. Din problemlösningsförmåga och passion för inbyggda system gör dig till en viktig tillgång i vårt växande team.
   

  

**Kravprofil:**
* Civilingenjör eller högskoleingenjör inom datateknik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som utvecklare inom embedded software (C/C++)
* God vana att arbeta i Linux-miljöer och förståelse för hur Linux används i inbyggda system.
* God kommunikationsförmåga i både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* God förståelse för mjukvarubaserade krav på hårdvara
* Förmåga att metodiskt designa mjukvarulösningar inom en arkitektonisk ram innan implementation
* Grundläggande kunskaper om realtidssystem


**Meriterande:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av utveckling inom embedded software (C/C++)
* Erfarenhet av mjukvarutransformation och utvecklingspipeliner


 Vi värdesätter din personlighet lika mycket som dina tekniska färdigheter. Vi söker dig som är resultatorienterad, en stark lagspelare, en god kommunikatör och som visar personligt ledarskap. Din passion för att utveckla innovativa lösningar och ditt engagemang för kontinuerligt lärande gör dig till en utmärkt kandidat för vårt team.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 För att du gillar tanken på att arbeta som ett produktbolag samtidigt som du vill ha variationen som kommer med att vara konsult. Det handlar om att leverera produkter och tjänster som ett team. Kärnan i vardagen är kunskapsdelning. All kod granskas, snabba beslutsvägar och stor frihet ger dig möjligheten att utveckla dina färdigheter. Teamet är självstyrande, så hur problemet löses är upp till dig. Du och ditt team väljer teknologierna som behövs för att lösa uppgiften, inte tvärtom. I slutändan handlar det om att vi vill ge dig möjligheten att fokusera på det du älskar mest – att lösa tekniska problem.
   

  

 Alla projekt, oavsett om det handlar om självkörande fordon, medicintekniska lösningar för att bekämpa cancer, eller en streamingtjänst, har en sak gemensamt: de är alla molnbaserade lösningar och produkter. Mob programming, kodgranskning, tech talks, hackathons och certifieringar är några av de sätt vi kan bli ännu bättre tillsammans. Det är vad det handlar om – att uppnå saker tillsammans. Du är omgiven av människor som bryr sig. Inte bara om projektet och teknologin, utan också om varandra. Vi gör det som ett team, och det är så vi tar oss framåt.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa, utveckla och optimera backend-lösningar med fokus på Azure eller AWS.
* Implementera microservices för att säkerställa skalbara och effektiva system.
* Designa och implementera RESTful eller GraphQL API.
* Arbeta med relationsdatabaser (t.ex. MySQL) och NoSQL-lösningar (t.ex. MongoDB).
* Samarbeta med front-end utvecklare, data engineers och andra för att skapa integrerade system.
* Bidra med nya idéer och håll dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling (Java, NodeJS, .Net, C#).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molntjänster som Azure eller AWS.
* Erfarenhet av containerteknologier (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Kunskap om CI/CD-processer och verktyg.
* Goda kommunikationsfärdigheter och vana att arbeta i team.
* Kandidatexamen inom datavetenskap eller liknande område.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska.


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-10-18. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Experienced Game Designer
description:
Are you an experienced designer who want to work with a small but ambitious team where making an impact on the games we develop is not a perk, but a common goal? We are looking for a hands-on designer that can take on the responsibility of content delivery as well as heading the collaboration between cross-disciplinary strike teams.
 



  





**About us** 




 COFFEE STAIN NORTH is a small game developer based in Stockholm that belongs to the Coffee Stain Group. Since the company was founded in 2013, we have grown to 30 employees and are now open to adding a couple of new friends!
 



  





*Goat Simulator 3 is a third-person sandbox adventure developed by Coffee Stain North in which the player can live out their wildest dreams... as a goat. Released in 2022, this open-* 
 world sandbox game takes the chaotic spirit of the original to new heights and offers expanded multiplayer support, a larger and more detailed environment, and even more absurd physics-driven gameplay. Players can explore the island of San Angora solo or with friends, wreaking havoc as a goat (or one of many unlockable characters) through a wide range of quests, mini-games, and bizarre encounters.
 



  





*Understanding games like Goat Simulator 3 means appreciating the fine line between "broken" and "brilliant." If that sounds like your kind of energy,* 
 come and get to know our herd!
 



  





**The role** 




 As Designer at CSN, you will work hands on in engine, build and implement features/content, be part of content ideation, fix issues, as well as support collaboration between disciplines.
 



 You will:
 


* Carry ideas from conceptualization through to detailed design.
* Create prototypes and make final implementations for gameplay mechanics and objectives.
* Ensure that features developed by the design team are coherent with other game systems and the overall game vision.
* Help with organizing cross-disciplinary strike-teams to shape and deliver content for the game.



  





**Your background** 




 To succeed in the role, we see that you have 4+ years of experience in a game designer role and have been part of at least one full project cycle. We work in Unreal Engine 4 and Blueprint visual scripting and prior work experience with these tools is a big plus.
 



 To enjoy this role, we believe that you are a person who can be part of fostering a collaborative environment with a focus on ideas and solutions. Furthermore, we believe that your previous experience enables you to identify and implement improvements that enhance efficiency and productivity, all with the end goal of creating designs that prioritize the player's experience. If you also want to infuse your work with humor, we could be a match!
 



 At CSN we have employees from different parts of the world, and it’s therefore mandatory to be fluent in English, both verbally and in writing.
 



  





 Lastly, we believe we can do even better as a team when your creativity shapes not only your own work but also our studio culture and our games. We actively work to empower our employees by helping everyone strive toward more responsibility, ownership, and autonomy. You will be an important part of this, and it’s therefore important to us that you have the same mindset.
 



  





**Perks** 
**of working at Coffee Stain** 




 We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits that go beyond the usual payments to your pension fund and insurances.
 


* We believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so on top of the wellness grant you get some paid time off to work out. Did we mention there are several gyms right beside our office?
* Every fourth week it’s creative Friday which lets your inner passion blossom.
* To have fun together and get inspired, we play games on the clock every fourth Friday.
* We also have great parental benefits, including extra pay on top of what you get from the social insurance agency during your parental leave.
* And, of course, you will be part of a wonderful team of colleagues working on an exciting high-profile project.



  





**Practical info** 




 The position is permanent, full-time, 40 hours per week. We have a hybrid setup and offer the possibility of working from home two days per week. Our office is newly renovated, and located in Kungsholmen, Fridhemsplan. We have, among other things, a ping-pong table, a big lounge area where we hang out, watch movies, or play games together, and last but not least – a giant goat statue (what more do you need?).
 



  





 Apart from us, the Coffee Stain Group consists of a myriad of successful studios, among them COFFEE STAIN STUDIOS (Sanctum and Satisfactory), Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic), Tuxedo Labs (Teardown) and COFFEE STAIN PUBLISHING who work with close partners like Iron Gate (Valheim), to name a few.
 



  





**Your application** 




 If you are interested, please apply! Due to GDPR, we can’t accept applications through email. If you have any questions regarding the role, please reach out to Maria Sjöman, HR, maria.sjoman@coffeestain.com.

title: Software Engineer within Identity and Access Management
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The Position**
 Are you passionate about security and identity in complex systems? Are you looking to solve multi-faceted problems coordinating identity solutions across multiple enterprise systems and stakeholders? We are looking for someone to implement a centralized IAM solution across our diverse portfolio of healthcare software products, as well as collaborate with our enterprise architecture and ITOps teams to help design technical and service solutions.
   

  

 We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer with expertise in Identity and Access Management, preferably with Red Hat Build of Keycloak (RHBK) and other modern IAM technologies. This role is critical to building the technical implementation and to contributing to the operational service model for our next-generation IAM solution.
   

  

 You will work across product teams to understand diverse requirements, lead the modernization of legacy IAM systems, and drive the consolidation into a cohesive, enterprise-grade solution. You will work as a part of our containerization team tasked with centralizing common services and coordinating deployment across several cluster configurations. You must be a great collaborator, with the ability to coordinate and consolidate different requirements from a variety of internal stakeholders and customers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Coordinate with multiple roles on the design and development of a unified IAM platform across multiple enterprise products.
* Implement scalable, secure, and compliant IAM solutions using modern technologies (e.g., RHBK, OAuth2, OIDC, SAML, SCIM).
* Collaborate with product and infrastructure teams to gather requirements and ensure seamless integration.
* Design operational models for IAM services including provisioning, monitoring, incident response, and lifecycle management.
* Define and implement access policies, role-based access control (RBAC), and identity federation strategies.
* Evaluate and integrate third-party IAM tools and services where appropriate.
* Mentor junior engineers and contribute to IAM best practices across the organization.


**We offer**
 Join a highly skilled and motivated international team that plays a central role in Cambio’s mission to drive meaningful change in the healthcare and welfare sector. We bring together a unique combination of deep expertise and a holistic understanding of both our organization and the broader societal needs. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to see how strategic work with shaping the future can lead to delivery and implementation of real impactful solutions.
   

  

**You’ll Also Enjoy**
* A truly international work environment with annual gatherings that bring the whole team together
* A warm and inclusive team culture with strong “we-feeling” — we support each other through both big challenges and everyday matters
* Regular local team meetings and spontaneous office interactions that make collaboration smooth and enjoyable
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and innovative working methods
* Opportunities for continuous learning, career growth, and personal development
* Flexible work arrangements based on trust and responsibility


 Come grow with us and help shape the future of welfare services in Sweden.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Proven experience in designing and implementing IAM solutions in complex enterprise environments.
* Strong hands-on experience with RHBK or related technologies.
* Deep understanding of authentication and authorization protocols (OAuth2, OIDC, SAML, LDAP).
* Experience modernizing legacy IAM systems and consolidating disparate solutions.
