title: Thesis project: The evolution of software craftsmanship in the age of AI and low-code
description:
Husqvarna Group, a global leader in outdoor power products, invites you to join our 150 people strong Digital Products & Innovation team for a bachelor or master thesis project. We are a world-class digital product organization dedicated to creating innovative digital services that enhance our customer's experience.  

Our agile DevOps teams value customer focus, collaboration, and craftsmanship. We're an empowered and diverse group that takes pride in shaping our own ways of working.  

The Challenge
The world of software development is undergoing a dramatic transformation. The rise of AI and low-code platforms is rapidly reshaping the day-to-day work of developers, shifting the focus from manual coding to a greater emphasis on productivity and strategic problem-solving. This shift presents a unique opportunity to redefine what it means to be a software engineer.
We're looking for students to help us explore this new landscape. Your research will help us understand the practical implications of these technologies and how they can be leveraged to deliver greater value to our customers.  

Proper area of education  

Bachelor or Master in Software Engineering, Business Administration or any other relevant field  

Possible research directions
We're open to exploring a range of topics. You will collaborate with our team to define the final research question based on your interests and our business needs. Some potential areas include:* Human–AI Collaboration  

Investigate how developers can collaborate effectively with AI-powered tools in areas such as prototyping, code generation, refactoring and quality assurance.
* Low-Code Integration  

Explore strategies for adopting and integrating low-code solutions into enterprise systems, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and long-term value.
* Architecture in the Age of AI and Low-Code  

Examine how these technologies influence software architecture. What new patterns, design principles, or trade-offs emerge when blending AI-driven components and low-code platforms with traditional systems?
* Measuring Impact  

Develop a framework to measure the business impact of AI and low-code adoption, from productivity gains to product quality improvements.
* Product Quality Assurance  

Assess how AI can help monitor, visualize and improve software product quality across the development lifecycle.
* Data Quality Management  

Research how AI can detect gaps, predict issues, and automatically correct inconsistencies in master data.


By conducting your thesis at Husqvarna Group, you will:* Work alongside a diverse team of skilled professionals in a modern digital product organization.
* Explore cutting-edge technologies with real-world applications.
* Contribute to redefining the future of software craftsmanship in a global industry leader.


How to apply  

Please send in your application with CV and cover letter no later than November 28th. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications by email.  

Are you ready to help us shape the future of software development? If you're passionate about innovation and want to explore the intersection of technology and craftsmanship, we'd love to hear from you.  

Read about Husqvarna Group here:  

https://www.husqvarnagroup.com/ *Husqvarna Group is a world-leading producer of outdoor power products for garden,* *park* *and forest care. Products include chainsaws, trimmers, robotic lawn* *mowers* *and ride-on lawn mowers.**The Group is also the European leader in garden watering products and a world leader in cutting equipment and diamond tools for the construction and stone industries. The Group’s products and solutions are sold under the main brands Husqvarna & Gardena that serve professionals in more than 140 countries.* *T**he Group has around 12,000 employees in 40 countries.*
Last date to apply:
We are continuously accepting applications

title: DevOps Engineer
description: The role requires building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines to streamline software delivery, automating infrastructure provisioning, and ensuring systems run smoothly and securely. The engineer will collaborate with development teams to design scalable cloud solutions, monitor performance, troubleshoot issues, and drive continuous improvement. Responsibilities also include mentoring junior team members, contributing to disaster recovery planning, and defining key metrics for system reliability.

title: Senior Engineer
description:
Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we’re also on a mission – to build a better world through the power of play.
  
Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It’s the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.
  
About the Role
  
The Minecraft Services and Infrastructure team is looking for a Senior Engineer to drive reliability and efficiency in our tools and services and to improve the overall player experience. Your role will be to advocate for best-in-class technologies, helping define best practices in code development and designing scalable solutions, and enhancing engineering practices by taking end-to-end ownership for development and quality-related cloud hosted service infrastructure, microservice development, and deployment technologies. You will work closely with Services and Infrastructure engineering developers, partner teams, and other disciplines (Design, Production, and Quality) to enable player scenarios and improve the ability of our teams to create reliable services and performant experiences.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Provide technical leadership and guidance to the engineering team during code reviews and root cause analysis.
  
Architect and implement scalable and maintainable infrastructure, service and deployment solutions.
  
Contribute to the development of engineering processes and methodologies to improve efficiency and effectiveness of service developers across the organization.
  
Drive alignment on infrastructure concerning a shared vision, strategy, and planning.
  
  

What you’ll need to succeed
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

7+ years of technical engineering experience with coding languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, or Python.
  
Proven understanding of Azure for cloud-based architectures, compute, storage, cache, or comparable cloud-based web service resources.
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Proven understanding of deployment strategies or technologies including, but not limited to, infrastructure as code (Terraform), GitOps, Jenkins , and Azure DevOps
  
Excellent problem-solving skills and a service-oriented mindset
  
Experienced in mentoring teams and less experienced engineers.
  
Ability to communicate strategic recommendations to the team and leadership.
  
  

Mojang Studios
  
Mojang Studios is a Microsoft-owned game developer. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We’re always working on new and exciting ways to expand the Minecraft universe.
  
Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.
  
We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we’re also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.
  
To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by Söder Mälarstrand, it’s filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.
  
But in the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!

title: Field Marketing Manager, Scandinavia (Maternity...
description:
**Welcome to Eficode**


We are building the future of software development - specialising in Cloud, DevOps, AI, and Agile. We help our customers transform into software-driven organisations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, emphasis on mental wellbeing, and a supportive, autonomous team culture.


We are now seeking an experienced marketer to join our Field Marketing division in Scandinavia for a minimum 12-month maternity leave contract. Interested? Apply today!

 **Role purpose**


As a Field Marketing Manager, you will play a key role in driving demand and accelerating growth across the Scandinavian market. Your mission is to generate high-quality leads and support the sales pipeline through targeted, impactful marketing initiatives.


You’ll take local ownership of planning and executing field marketing campaigns tailored to the tech industry—combining events, trade shows, and digital programs to reach and engage potential customers. Collaborating closely with Sales and cross-functional Marketing teams, you’ll shape and deliver a localized marketing strategy with compelling content and messaging in alignment with other marketing colleagues.  

  

This role is ideal for a hands-on marketer who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about turning strategy into action that drives measurable results.

 **Responsibilities**

*Your main responsibilities will include (but won’t be limited to):*

* Build strong relationships with local marketing contacts at key technology partners.
* Collaborate with sales to qualify leads and accelerate them through the pipeline.
* Work closely with country managers, along with sales, product, and content teams to develop impactful marketing materials
* Localize and regularly update marketing content, such as digital assets, in relevant languages.
* Work closely with PR & marketing agencies to optimise local marketing performance.
* Provide local market insights to support targeted messaging and brand positioning.
* Plan and participate in events, trade shows, webinars, and other field initiatives.
* Recruit customer speakers for marketing activities such as webinars and events.
* Brief and align local teams ahead of marketing campaigns and events.
* Conduct case study interviews with reference customers.
* Track and optimize the performance of field marketing activities.

 **Role requirements**

*You will make a great match for this role if you have:*

* **5-7 + Years of experience:** Minimum 5 years of proven experience in field marketing, demand generation, and account-based marketing, preferably in a B2B or SaaS environment.

* **Data-Driven:** Expertise in tracking and analyzing local OKRs, marketing metrics, and ROI to optimize marketing performance, and utilising Artificial Intelligence (AI and AIO)

**- AI & Digital Marketing -** Proven expertise and knowledge in Digital Marketing & AI technologies

* **Vendor Management:** Experience managing external vendors or contractors to execute field marketing programs and support international marketing needs.

* **Stakeholder Management:** Aligning internally with country managers and sales, and working closely with different BA’s, partners and customers.

* **Campaign Execution:** Proven ability to execute field campaigns and local marketing events (e.g., meet-ups, seminars, conferences) and drive lead nurturing initiatives.

* **Communication Skills:** Strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders, present ideas, and deliver marketing content.

* **Event Management:** Experience in organizing and managing large-scale, high-impact events, including both virtual and in-person formats.

* **Language Skills:** Proficiency in both Swedish and English (spoken and written) to better engage with local stakeholders and customers.

 **Desired Skills**

*It would be a bonus if you have:*

* **CRM/Marketing Automation:** Familiarity with marketing automation tools (e.g., HubSpot, Marketo) and CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce) for tracking leads and nurturing campaigns.

* **Tech industry experience**, particularly within cloud or DevOps, would be a huge plus

* **Ability to speak other languages** such as Danish or Norwegian would be a bonus but not mandatory

 **What’s in it for you?**

* A diverse, international work environment with hybrid and remote work opportunities

* 30 days paid holiday per year

* Access to benefits including health care allowance, life & accident insurance, and salary exchange options

* Continuous development, internal Share & Learns, personal and professional development and certifications

* To find out more about life at Eficode, and hear what our people think about us, click **here.**

 **Location**


This role is a full-time fixed-term contract for a minimum of 12 months (potential to be extended) and is available in Stockholm, Malmö or Gothenburg.  

  

*Salary Development*

*At Eficode, we believe your compensation should reflect the impact you make and how you grow along the way. Your salary develops through regular check-ins with your team lead, where we look at things like your skills, experience, client work, feedback, and overall contribution — both to your projects and to our culture. As a consultancy, it’s natural that factors like time spent on billable client work are part of the picture — but so are your development, collaboration, and everyday efforts that drive value. We also carry out a company-wide salary review once a year.*

*On top of your salary, we offer a broad mix of benefits, both financial and non-financial, to support your well-being, work-life balance, and professional growth.*

*Find out more about our benefits* *here**.*

 ***DE&I***

*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants. We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognise that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds, and cultures, we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*

*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information or an image of yourself in your job application.*

**#LI-LO1**

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about observability, large-scale infrastructure, and working in a collaborative, forward-thinking tech environment? If your answer is yes, we might have a new opportunity for you!


My name is Marcus Lydholm, and **I lead the DM&C IT Observability unit within Telia’s Tech IT PC Data Mediation and Cybersecurity division** . We’re a dedicated team of experts building and maintaining Telia’s internal observability platforms - tools that empower our DevOps and maintenance teams to develop and operate services with confidence and clarity.


We are now looking for a **Senior DevOps Engineer** to join us - someone eager to grow, learn, and contribute to the future of observability at Telia. If you thrive in agile teams and enjoy working with cutting-edge technologies, we’d love to hear from you.


**As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll…**

Be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining internal observability platforms like **Grafana Dashboard as a Service (DaaS)** and **Observability as a Service (OaaS).** You’ll integrate and manage tools such as **Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, Mimir, Tempo** , and **OpenTelemetry** , while operating and optimizing applications on **Rancher-managed Kubernetes clusters** and virtual machines. Your role includes automating service provisioning with **Ansible and ArgoCD** , supporting DevOps operations across multiple **Nordic and Baltic countries** , and maintaining a robust toolchain with **GitHub and Keycloak** . You’ll monitor system performance, participate in a **24/7 on-call rotation** , and actively contribute to continuous improvement in a collaborative team environment.


**Who we’re looking for…**

We’re looking for someone who brings both technical excellence and a collaborative spirit. You should be naturally curious, open to learning, and eager to share your knowledge with others. A proactive mindset and strong sense of ownership are key - you take initiative, follow through on commitments, and elevate the quality of every project you touch. Precision matters here, so attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions are essential. Most importantly, you value teamwork and contribute positively to a culture of trust, growth, and shared success.


From a technical perspective, you should have deep experience with Kubernetes, including managing full cluster lifecycles and orchestrating containerized workloads. You’ve worked hands-on with observability stacks like Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki, and understand how to monitor performance, analyze logs, and trace distributed systems. You’re skilled in CI/CD practices using tools like ArgoCD and GitHub Actions, and familiar with Infrastructure as Code using Pulumi or Terraform. A solid programming foundation is required - Rust experience is a bonus - and you should be comfortable navigating Linux environments and troubleshooting system-level issues. Familiarity with OpenTelemetry is a plus, and fluency in English is essential for clear communication in our cross-functional, international teams.


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**(For applicants in Lithuania, monthly salary range for this position: 4200 – 6400 EUR before tax deduction.)**

**Ready to make better happen?**

If you are in for a fantastic opportunity - join my team! We’re **mainly located in Sweden** , with key locations in **Solna, Karlstad, and Sundsvall** . However, this position is **also open in Helsinki (Finland), Vilnius (Lithuania), Tallinn (Estonia)** , and **Oslo (Norway).** We´re looking forward to your application **by 30th of September** . Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via other channels.


Required background checks will be performed.


Got questions? Please reach out to Marcus Lydholm at marcus.lydholm@teliacompany.com, +46730513230.


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Engineering Manager METS Analytics, Lund
description:
Job Title
Engineering Manager METS Analytics, Lund
Job Description*Do you see yourself as a team-oriented person who is driven by developing and inspiring others towards a common goal?* *Do you want to lead, and develop, a team developing analytic features using cutting edge technologies and to help us adapt and expand AXIS analytics for our Extended Video Products?* *At METS we are redesigning great AXIS products for new and extended use cases. We call it "Reimagining the Solution"; come join us at our HQ in Lund!*  

Who is your future team?
EVP METS Analytics is a new department within AXIS working with Analytics for Explosion protected cameras, Thermal Cameras, Specialty Cameras and multichannel products. Working together in a team, you will be a part of how our new products come to life. You will be collaborating with co-workers from different disciplines, such as software, image quality, mechanical design, electronics, production test and more. We have a very close co-operation, and a friendly team-spirit at AXIS, ensuring an agile development of market-leading products. We strongly believe in knowledge sharing and insights. It’s a great part of our culture!  

What will you do?
As an Analytics Engineering manager at AXIS you will play an essential part in the development of our new products as we invest heavily in future solutions based on technologies like Deep Learning/Machine Learning. The products in our department has different use cases than the rest of AXIS portfolio and therefore we need to adapt our Analytics features to our products and to build strong use cases for our customers in cooperation with our other teams working with analytics.  

Your main tasks will be to:* Lead, inspire, and develop your team of skilled engineers related to both the needs of the company as well as in balance with the needs of every individual.
* Contribute to the strategic direction of our analytics area.
* Collaborate and work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver outstanding results.
* Run the day-to-day operations making sure that we have the right competence.
* Perform standard management tasks like development talks, salary setting, budgeting, recruitment, etc.

  

Who are you?
You have a strong technical interest and experience in driving strategic and technical initiatives. To inspire and challenge both your manager and coworkers is something you feel comfortable with. You love leading from a people perspective, securing a safe environment of coaching and giving feedback and collaboration, identifying development needs, taking actions and follow-up. You see the power of diversity; understand your employees and you do whatever it takes to make their situation as good as possible while still getting the most out of your organization. You combine the skill of listening with the skill of deciding and can find a good balance in between the two. You are an open-minded, empathetic, and cooperative person - a leader who can make people feel enthusiastic about their work. Since we are working closely with other departments and external stakeholders, you find it easy and have experience in interacting and networking with customers, external partners and organizations. You have fluent communication skills in Swedish and English.  

In addition to the above you have/are:* Leadership experience, such as Team Lead, Project Manager or Line Manager.
* A Degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* Proven experience leading software development teams in an Agile setup.
* Interest in developing and challenge yourself as leader and manager.
* Familiarity with managing Agile and/or DevOps teams.
* Fluent in English.

  

Bonuspoints for experience in:* Computer Vision/Video Analytics Knowledge: Passion for cutting-edge AI technologies.
* Software Architecture Development: Understanding of SW system architecture.
* Tool Development: Experience creating tools to enhance productivity.
* Embedded Development: Familiarity with embedded system development.
* Cloud Development: Proficiency in cloud-based solution development.
* Customer development projects: Previous involvement in Customer/End User development projects.

  

What can Axis do for you?
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle. To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis  

Ready to act?
Are you thrilled about the job description and found a personal match? Send in your application! If you have any questions, get in touch with hiring manager, Therese Svensson at +46 761 757912.
We review applications continuously so do not wait to send in your application!*This recruitment is handled solely by Axis Communications AB, and we politely but firmly decline all calls from recruitment and consulting companies.*
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-10-13*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO**


H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands.


As a Platform Engineer within our AI, Analytics & Data department, you will:

* Design, develop, and manage scalable data platforms on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Implement and manage infrastructure as code using Terraform
* Automate deployment processes using GitHub Actions
* Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to ensure data availability and quality
* Monitor and optimize data pipelines for performance and cost-efficiency
* Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data infrastructure
* Work in an internationally agile-driven environment on solutions used across the globe

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**


You’ll be part of the AI, Analytics & Data department; a dynamic and innovative team at the cutting edge of data-driven decision-making. We leverage advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning to tackle complex challenges and drive business growth. You’ll collaborate with passionate technologists and leaders who are driving the digital transformation of H&M.

**WHO YOU ARE**

*We are looking for people with:*

* Equivalent hands-on experience in a similar technical role or a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* Strong expertise in GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Workflows, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, etc.)
* Experience with CI/CD tools, particularly GitHub Actions
* Experience with dbt for data transformation
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices
* Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or similar languages

*And people who are:*

* Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to take full ownership of initiatives
* Excellent problem-solvers with attention to detail
* Strong communicators and collaborators
* Comfortable working independently and as part of a team

**WHO WE ARE**


H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**


At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.

* A tech-driven environment with cutting-edge tools and platforms
* Opportunities to grow and shape the future of data and AI at H&M
* A collaborative culture that values innovation, inclusion, and continuous learning
* All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound

**JOIN US**


Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things: our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Cloud Specialist
description:
**Om oss:**  

Cloudo är en innovativ leverantör av moln-, IT- och telefonitjänster inom B2B. Vi befinner oss mitt i en otrolig tillväxtresa och söker nu en passionerad Cloud Specialist. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och forma framtiden i ett företag som värdesätter engagemang och ambition.
  
  

**Om rollen:**  

Som Cloud Specialist hos Cloudo kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i våra kunders resa mot moderna IT-lösningar. Du kommer att arbeta med ett brett spektrum av teknologier – där Microsoft 365 och Azure är centrala delar, men där även andra plattformar och lösningar förekommer beroende på kundens behov. Rollen innebär att du ansvarar för licenshantering, molnarkitektur och implementation, samt att du agerar teknisk expert i kunddialoger och säljmöten.
  
Även om rollen är specialistinriktad förekommer det att du stöttar supportteamet med att hantera inkommande ärenden via telefon, mejl och chatt – både fjärrmässigt och onsite. Detta ger dig en helhetsbild av kundens miljö och stärker samarbetet inom teamet.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**  

* Ansvara för licenser och CSP
* Implementera och optimera Microsoft 365-tjänster samt andra molnplattformar
* Utveckla och förvalta lösningar i Azure och andra infrastrukturtjänster
* Onboarda och utveckla kunder kring våra tjänster
* Agera teknisk expert under säljmöten med kund och säljare
* Automatisera processer och implementera DevOps-principer
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att integrera molntjänster i våra applikationer
* Vid behov stötta supportteamet med felsökning och ärendehantering


**Vi söker dig som:**  

* Har gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med molntjänster, särskilt Microsoft Azure och Microsoft 365
* Har bred teknisk förståelse och kan arbeta med olika plattformar och infrastrukturlösningar
* Är kommunikativ och kan förklara tekniska lösningar för både teknisk och icke-teknisk personal
* Är strukturerad, självgående och har ett starkt kundfokus
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**  

* Certifieringar inom Microsoft Azure (t.ex. Azure Solutions Architect, Azure Administrator)
* Erfarenhet av nätverk, virtualisering, lagring och backup
* B-körkort för kundbesök


**Vad vi erbjuder:**  

* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Utvecklingsplan och kompetensutveckling
* Pension
* Möjlighet att arbeta från våra kontor i Lund eller Stockholm City
* Start: Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och genomförd säkerhetskontroll


**Ansökan:**  

Vi rekryterar löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: Senior Baseband Tester
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity:**  

Are you ready to shape the future of 5G and 6G?

  

Within the L1 Software Development team in the Product Engineering Group RU Baseband Software, we are dedicated to designing and implementing Physical Layer Baseband functions for our Radio products. Our goal is to maintain Ericsson’s leadership in the market by delivering cutting-edge L1 solutions across diverse deployment scenarios, frequency bands, radio platforms and 3GPP/ORAN standards.

  

We are currently looking for a curious, driven professionals with a passion for innovation to join our outstanding Radio Baseband software team in Kista as Baseband Tester.

 **What you will do:**  

In this role, you'll engage with cutting-edge technology playing a key role in the testing and integration of functionalities on our various Radio variants for 5G and soon 6G deployments.  

* Validate, troubleshoot and integrate new Baseband features in a full end-to-end test environment for Ericsson Radio products.
* Conduct legacy regression testing and feature interaction testing to ensure seamless functionality.
* Work across multiple QA areas, including stability, robustness, resilience, and automation.
* Apply expertise in wireless standards such as 5G and LTE, including their underlying protocols.
* Operate in advanced lab environments to diagnose issues and integrate complex software components.
* Create detailed test plans, document analyses, and share insights with cross-functional teams.
* Collaborate with engineers across design, systems, and QA for swift and effective problem resolution.
* Drive innovation by staying up-to-date with industry best practices and new technologies.
* Thrive in an agile development setting, delivering both product and test code through our DevOps infrastructure.
 **Skills you bring:**  

To be successful in this role you bring:  

* Master’s degree in a relevant field, with 2+ years of industry experience in telecom or related areas, preferably focused on feature testing.
* Strong expertise in LTE, NR/5G, and wireless air interfaces, including end-to-end feature testing (e.g., gNodeB and UE integration).
* Excellent knowledge of Moshell and other Ericsson RAN troubleshooting tools.
* Proficiency in Python and familiarity with QA areas such as stability, robustness, and resilience.
* Knowledge of signaling, and protocol layers, plus RF testing.
* Experience in planning lab setups, designing/executing test plans, analyzing data, and producing high-quality test reports.
* Strong debugging, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis skills.
* Working knowledge of UNIX and Windows environments.
* Passion for software development, problem-solving, and sharing technical know-how.
* Skilled in working with international, multi-site teams, encouraging open communication and bringing a can-do attitude.
* Excellent written/verbal communication, interpersonal, time management, and multitasking abilities.
* Able to thrive in a fast-paced, agile setting, keeping up with emerging industry trends and delivering complex solutions on time with quality.
* Proactive in improving quality assurance practices and driving creative solutions.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals, and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation**

*Do you want to enable green energy transition, and together with colleagues be a part of building and deliver customized control systems to meet our customer’s and the world's needs for sustainable, flexible, and secure energy? Then we are eager to meet you!*

*This department have one of the most important roles within the HVDC organization. Here we draw and set up the architectural foundations for the Control & Protection delivery, based on the customer requirements, SLD etc. The group is mostly focusing on engineering in the early stages of the projects but also contributing with expert support throughout the whole project execution.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 Experience with
   

  

* GitLab CI/YAML
* AWS (infrastructure & cloud-native services)
* Terraform
* Kubernetes
* Bazel or Conan build systems
* Docker & Linux
* Python or similar scripting
* Datadog
* JFROG Artifactory


 Education: Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred.
   

  

 Language: English (professional working proficiency). Swedish is beneficial but not explicitly required.
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 19-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
  Senior DevOps Engineer
 



  
 **Location:** 
  Sweden (Hybrid & Remote – Flexible Work Model)
 



  
 **Experience:** 
  5–10 years
 



  
 **Company:** 
  Databees
 



  





**About Databees** 




 Databees is a 
 **young, fast-growing leader in data and cloud engineering** 
 , empowering enterprises to modernize, scale, and innovate. Our expertise spans 
 **cloud-native transformations, automation-driven delivery pipelines, and robust data platforms** 
 . We partner with enterprise clients worldwide to design 
 **secure, resilient, and future-ready solutions** 
 . With a strong reputation in DevOps, Azure, and data engineering, Databees combines technical depth with client-focused collaboration.Our teams are 
 **trusted by global enterprises** 
  to deliver critical projects that accelerate digital transformation and business outcomes.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking a 
 **highly skilled DevOps Engineer** 
  with 5–10 years of experience to join our engineering team in Sweden. This is a 
 **hybrid role** 
  with flexible remote options, designed for professionals who have 
 **direct enterprise client experience** 
  and excel at 
 **infrastructure automation, CI/CD pipeline design, and scalable cloud solutions** 
 .
 



 As a strategic member of our DevOps practice, you will 
 **shape modern delivery pipelines** 
 , 
 **enhance platform reliability** 
 , and 
 **optimize performance** 
  for large-scale, dynamic applications. You will also collaborate with data engineering teams leveraging 
 **Azure and Databricks** 
  to drive advanced cloud solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, implement, and manage 
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
  for enterprise-grade applications.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning using 
 **Terraform** 
  and other IaC tools.
* Deploy, monitor, and optimize workloads on 
 **Azure** 
  (primary), with exposure to other clouds (AWS/GCP).
* Collaborate with development and data engineering teams to enable 
 **Databricks-based solutions** 
 .
* Drive containerization initiatives using 
 **Docker** 
  and orchestration platforms (
 **Kubernetes, Helm** 
 ).
* Establish monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions (
 **Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Azure Monitor** 
 ).
* Implement 
 **DevSecOps best practices** 
  ensuring compliance, security, and scalability.
* Act as a technical partner with 
 **enterprise clients** 
 , translating business requirements into efficient DevOps solutions.



  





**Required Skills & Experience** 



* **5–10 years** 
  of proven DevOps engineering experience in 
 **enterprise/client-facing environments** 
 .
* Hands-on expertise with 
 **CI/CD tools** 
  (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, CircleCI).
* **Azure as primary cloud** 
 , with experience in IaaS, PaaS, and hybrid deployments.
* **Databricks experience** 
  (deployment, orchestration, and optimization).
* **Infrastructure-as-Code** 
  expertise, primarily 
 **Terraform** 
 , and familiarity with Ansible/Pulumi.
* Containerization & orchestration proficiency: 
 **Docker, Kubernetes, Helm** 
 .
* Scripting expertise: 
 **Python, Bash, PowerShell** 
 , or Go.
* Strong knowledge of system monitoring, troubleshooting, and incident response.
* Experience working with 
 **direct enterprise clients** 
  in consulting or on-site engagements.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in 
 **global team environments** 
 .



  





**What We Offer** 



* **Hybrid & flexible work model** 
  promoting work-life balance.
* Competitive compensation and benefits aligned with 
 **global standards** 
 .
* Exposure to 
 **high-impact enterprise projects** 
  with direct client interaction.
* Opportunities for continuous learning in 
 **Azure, Databricks, and DevOps technologies** 
 .
* A 
 **collaborative, multicultural environment** 
  within a globally recognized company.



  





**How to Apply** 




 If you are a 
 **DevOps Engineer** 
  who thrives in hybrid environments, loves solving complex challenges, and enjoys working directly with enterprise clients, 
 **Databees is the place for you** 
 .
 



  





 Send your updated resume to 
 **mohammad.masroor.alam@databees.ai** 
  with the subject line: 
 **DevOps Engineer – Sweden**

title: Release Test Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **450 million active users** 
 per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.



  





 We, the
 **Release team** 
 , manage app releases across platforms. We coordinate with external and internal stakeholders to ensure seamless releases are delivered every week. We also monitor the quality of these releases, report and escalate blockers. As part of the team, you will help implement and improve Release processes for planning, operations, and continuous improvements . You will be expected to coach, guide and onboard people when it comes to release practices.
 



  





 As a Release Test Engineer, you will make sure that every step of the app release process is executed and that the results satisfy our release criteria. The steps include regression testing, risk analysis, coordination with Business units, cherry-picking of critical bugs as well as control and communication of features released. It also includes building new tools and enabling technologies to improve the Release process and enable other teams to deliver updates faster and more efficiently. You will be part of the Release team working and maintaining core processes at Truecaller.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




  




* Releasing the app across various platforms.
* Communicate and coordinate with Product and Engineering teams regarding releases every week.
* Drive cross-BU initiatives to enable or improve the Release Delivery process.
* Evaluate new modern tools and technologies to be integrated into the process.
* Maintain and improve CI pipelines.
* Onboarding of engineers to the release process.
* Develop and handle strategies for app releases.
* Create and document app release strategies and flows.
* Identify test activities and test dependencies that span across the backend and frontend domain to ensure the end to end quality.
* Coordinate/coach the developer’s participation in the team's test activities.
* Monitor app vitals and issue escalations raised internally and externally.
* Automate test cases to ensure faster and reliable regression coverage.
* Automate Release workflows.
* Be a gatekeeper for all team deliverables agreed quality levels to ensure that acceptance criteria and definition of done are met before a task is closed



  





**What you bring in:** 




  




* 3 to 7 years of relevant experience in Mobile app testing.
* Have a genuine passion for software quality and testing.
* Experience of testing in a medium or large-scale agile software development environment.
* Strong technical and troubleshooting skills.
* Familiarity with Data analysis, basic understanding of SQL, and handling data dashboards.
* Understanding and hands-on experience in UI test automation on mobile platforms, Android, iOS and Web automation.
* Experience with Android testing frameworks such as Espresso or Appium.
* Experience with Backend testing.
* Programming experience to be able to identify causes of problems in the code base and communicate efficiently with developers.
* Excellent manual testing skills.
* Experience with Issue & Project Tracking Software - JIRA.
* Experience with Android Studio and Xcode(optional).
* Experience in tools like Postman, Charles Proxy or similar.
* Experience with Firebase Crashlytics.
* Experience with version controlling tools like Github etc and CI/CD tools like Github actions etc.



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 




  




* Experience working in a Startup.
* Programming experience to be able to identify the causes of problems in the code base and communicate efficiently with developers.
* Building and maintaining automation frameworks from scratch.
* Experience in efficient communication with various stakeholders like POs, PMs, QAs etc
* Experience with working in multi-cultural and distributed environments.
* Experience with handling customer support issues.
* Experience in web platforms testing is good to have.



  





**Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





 Sounds like your dream job?
 



  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





 We only accept applications in English.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team** 
 : An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




  





 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands.
   

  

 As a Platform Engineer within our AI, Analytics & Data department, you will:
   

  

 → Design, develop, and manage scalable data platforms on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
   

  

 → Implement and manage infrastructure as code using Terraform
   

  

 → Automate deployment processes using GitHub Actions
   

  

 → Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to ensure data availability and quality
   

  

 → Monitor and optimize data pipelines for performance and cost-efficiency
   

  

 → Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations
   

  

 → Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data infrastructure
   

  

 → Work in an internationally agile-driven environment on solutions used across the globe
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of the AI, Analytics & Data department; a dynamic and innovative team at the cutting edge of data-driven decision-making. We leverage advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning to tackle complex challenges and drive business growth. You’ll collaborate with passionate technologists and leaders who are driving the digital transformation of H&M.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
 → Equivalent hands-on experience in a similar technical role or a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
   

  

 → Strong expertise in GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Workflows, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, etc.)
   

  

 → Experience with CI/CD tools, particularly GitHub Actions
   

  

 → Experience with dbt for data transformation
   

  

 → Solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices
   

  

 → Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or similar languages
   

  

*And people who are:*
 → Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to take full ownership of initiatives
   

  

 → Excellent problem-solvers with attention to detail
   

  

 → Strong communicators and collaborators
   

  

 → Comfortable working independently and as part of a team
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 → A tech-driven environment with cutting-edge tools and platforms
   

  

 → Opportunities to grow and shape the future of data and AI at H&M
   

  

 → A collaborative culture that values innovation, inclusion, and continuous learning
   

  

 → All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
   

  

 → All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things: our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
 Resources needed: 2

title: Tracab: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including Madden NFL football, EA SPORTS FC, NHL® hockey, and EA SPORTS UFC.
   

  

 The Tracab team is part of the EA SPORTS Tech organization. TRACAB’s advanced sports optical tracking helps unlock a new level of enhanced realism, animation and dynamic, real-time simulation for our fans, allowing us to generate near real-time insights for media broadcast teams, referees, players, coaches, and fans.
   

  

 We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team at Tracab, where you'll help us create cutting-edge sports broadcasting products. Your work will ensure our solutions are secure, reliable, and continuously improved to meet the high expectations of our customers.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Software and/or release engineering experience
* Ability to understand and work with complex releasing systems
* Algorithmization and scripting ability (Groovy, Python, PowerShell, Bash or any programming language)
* CI/CD software (Preferably Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, any other similar automation software)
* Docker experience (including creating images, Docker networking and Docker Compose).
* Strong experience with AWS - IAM,EC2,VPC,S3,ECS,Lambdas
* Using Terraform on daily bases
* Ansible and Packer experience
* Windows and Linux experience - (we are working on both OS)
* Experience with Atlasian softwares (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)


 Nice to haves
   

  

* Experience with releasing C++, Java, C#/.NET, or JS/TS/NodeJS applications
* Experience with SQL, noSQL databases, or MQs
* Experience with Kubernetes
* Advanced release concepts experience - releases of SaaS, releases to cloud, feature flagging, canary releases
* Experience with large-scale or distributed systems, SOA


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about observability, large-scale infrastructure, and working in a collaborative, forward-thinking tech environment? If your answer is yes, we might have a new opportunity for you!
   

  

 My name is Marcus Lydholm, and
 **I lead the DM&C IT Observability unit within Telia’s Tech IT PC Data Mediation and Cybersecurity division** 
 . We’re a dedicated team of experts building and maintaining Telia’s internal observability platforms - tools that empower our DevOps and maintenance teams to develop and operate services with confidence and clarity.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Senior DevOps Engineer** 
 to join us - someone eager to grow, learn, and contribute to the future of observability at Telia. If you thrive in agile teams and enjoy working with cutting-edge technologies, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you’ll…**
 Be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining internal observability platforms like
 **Grafana Dashboard as a Service (DaaS)** 
 and
 **Observability as a Service (OaaS).** 
 You’ll integrate and manage tools such as
 **Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, Mimir, Tempo** 
 , and
 **OpenTelemetry** 
 , while operating and optimizing applications on
 **Rancher-managed Kubernetes clusters** 
 and virtual machines. Your role includes automating service provisioning with
 **Ansible and ArgoCD** 
 , supporting DevOps operations across multiple
 **Nordic and Baltic countries** 
 , and maintaining a robust toolchain with
 **GitHub and Keycloak** 
 . You’ll monitor system performance, participate in a
 **24/7 on-call rotation** 
 , and actively contribute to continuous improvement in a collaborative team environment.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For…**
 We’re looking for someone who brings both technical excellence and a collaborative spirit. You should be naturally curious, open to learning, and eager to share your knowledge with others. A proactive mindset and strong sense of ownership are key - you take initiative, follow through on commitments, and elevate the quality of every project you touch. Precision matters here, so attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions are essential. Most importantly, you value teamwork and contribute positively to a culture of trust, growth, and shared success.
   

  

 From a technical perspective, you should have deep experience with Kubernetes, including managing full cluster lifecycles and orchestrating containerized workloads. You’ve worked hands-on with observability stacks like Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki, and understand how to monitor performance, analyze logs, and trace distributed systems. You’re skilled in CI/CD practices using tools like ArgoCD and GitHub Actions, and familiar with Infrastructure as Code using Pulumi or Terraform. A solid programming foundation is required - Rust experience is a bonus - and you should be comfortable navigating Linux environments and troubleshooting system-level issues. Familiarity with OpenTelemetry is a plus, and fluency in English is essential for clear communication in our cross-functional, international teams.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**(For applicants in Lithuania, monthly salary range for this position: 4200 – 6400 EUR before tax deduction.)**
**Ready to make better happen?**
 If you are in for a fantastic opportunity - join my team! We’re
 **mainly located in Sweden** 
 , with key locations in
 **Solna, Karlstad, and Sundsvall** 
 . However, this position is
 **also open in Helsinki (Finland), Vilnius (Lithuania), Tallinn (Estonia)** 
 , and
 **Oslo (Norway).** 
 We´re looking forward to your application
 **by 30th of September** 
 . Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via other channels.
   

  

 Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to Marcus Lydholm at marcus.lydholm@teliacompany.com, +46730513230.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer to join the Infra team at Soundtrack. The Infra team is at the heart of our platform and is responsible for scaling, modernising and maintaining the infrastructure that powers Soundtrack’s global music service.
   

  

 Right now, the team consists of three senior members, with deep infrastructure backgrounds. To ensure we can keep scaling with our growing customer base, we’re strengthening the team with an additional team member who brings solid infrastructure knowledge and developer/automation skills.
   

  

 You’ll be working closely with the Reliability team to improve monitoring and stability, and with our product development teams to ensure they can build on a robust, modern platform. Day to day, you’ll work with tools like Google Cloud, Kubernetes (GKE), Terraform, Helm and the Grafana stack to build, automate and evolve our infrastructure.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain Soundtrack’s infrastructure in Google Cloud and Kubernetes (GKE)
* Improve and manage automation and infrastructure to ensure scalability, cost-efficiency and robustness
* Use Terraform to set up and manage projects and clusters
* Install and manage applications in Kubernetes clusters using Helm
* Operate and evolve the monitoring platform (Grafana stack: Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Tempo)
* Partner with development teams to understand and meet their platform needs
* Contribute to long-term architectural improvements and infrastructure modernisation.


**About You**
 You're driven and
   

  

 independent, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ years of hands-on experience with Kubernetes (preferably GKE).
* 5+ years of experience with Terraform.
* Solid experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud. AWS or Azure is also relevant, but you must be willing and able to quickly get up to speed with GCP.
* Ability to work independently in a small, senior team environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and eagerness to learn new tools and technologies.


**Beneficial Requirements**
* Deep knowledge of Google Cloud.
* Expert knowledge of Terraform.
* Experience with Helm and the Grafana stack (Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Tempo).
* Programming experience in Go or Python (for internal tools and integrations).
* Previous experience working in a scale-up or tech company.
* Background in both infrastructure and development (hybrid skillset).


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office (if working from Stockholm)


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Full-Stack Developer Internship
description:
Do you want to be involved in continuously building a SaaS solution? Are you eager to work closely with the
 **co-founder & CTO** 
 of an innovative startup that’s transforming the e-commerce returns landscape? If you’re passionate about delivering value to customers and shaping a B2B product, this is the internship for you!
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* You will be involved in everything from new feature development, bug solving and releasing new versions to our production environment.
* You will also interact with our UI/UX team and frontend developers.
* You will be able to understand everything which goes into building our SaaS solution.
* You will also be involved in requirement gathering and interact with our customers when it comes to enhancements and bug-fixing.


**Who you are:**
* Internship should be part of your coursework.
* Fluent in English communication skills (other European languages are a plus)
* Web programming knowledge - preferably Python and React.js
* Understanding of how websites work end-to-end
* Sql skills


**Bonus skills:**
* Knowledge of HTML / CSS / Javascript

title: Senior back-end engineer
description:
**About Arkus AI** 




 Arkus AI is on a mission to revolutionise medicine and healthcare through intelligent, AI-powered technologies. We are developing autonomous AI agents and a robust AI platform to support clinicians, researchers, and healthcare administrators in addressing some of the most complex challenges in medicine.
 



  





 We are looking for a highly motivated and outstanding
 **Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI experience** 
 to help design and develop our AI agent platform. In this role, you will focus primarily on back-end systems and infrastructure while leveraging your understanding of generative AI (LLMs, agent frameworks) to enable cutting-edge healthcare applications.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Architect, build, and maintain the
 **core back-end infrastructure** 
 for our AI agent platform
* Design and implement
 **RESTful APIs, orchestration logic, and integrations** 
 with external systems and tools
* Develop and manage
 **databases** 
 (SQL/NoSQL) and implement
 **event-driven architectures** 
 for real-time agent operations
* Work closely with AI/ML engineers to integrate
 **LLM-driven capabilities** 
 (via APIs or open-source models) into the platform
* Ensure scalability, security, compliance, and high performance of back-end systems
* Implement observability, CI/CD pipelines, and containerised deployments (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Write and maintain
 **unit and integration tests** 
 to ensure system reliability
* Mentor junior developers and contribute to best practices and technical standards



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* **6+ years of experience** 
 in back-end or software engineering, building production-grade systems
* Proven expertise in
 **back-end development** 
 with Node.js/TypeScript and Python
* Hands-on experience with
 **RESTful API design** 
 , SQL/NoSQL databases, and distributed systems
* Familiarity with
 **LLMs and agent frameworks** 
 (e.g., LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGPT, Semantic Kernel) and how they integrate into back-end platforms
* Experience with
 **vector databases** 
 (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate) and retrieval pipelines
* Knowledge of
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 (AWS, GCP, or Azure), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines
* Experience with observability tools (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK, etc.)
* Bonus: background in healthcare systems (FHIR, EHRs) or working in
 **regulated environments** 
 (HIPAA/GDPR)
* Strong communication, architectural thinking, and mentoring skills



  





**Why Join Arkus AI?** 



* Help
 **shape the future of AI agent platforms** 
 in healthcare
* Work on
 **cutting-edge back-end challenges** 
 at the intersection of AI and system engineering
* Be part of a
 **mission-driven, fast-moving team** 
 with real clinical impact
* Competitive salary, equity, and hybrid work flexibility
